node.title: Chicago Wants Jussie Smollet to Pay $130K for Police Brought Into Hate Crime Hoax
node.alt: The City of Chicago confirmed it will continue its lawsuit against actor Jussie Smollett to recoup costs for the investigation he was convicted of staging. In this photo, Smollett is seen after his court appearance at Leighton Courthouse on March 26, 2019 in Chicago, Illinois.
node.description: The city is looking to win back money spent investigating the attack that the actor was convicted of staging.
node.content:
["The City of Chicago confirmed it will be pursuing a $130,000 lawsuit against actor Jussie Smollett after he was found guilty on December 9 of staging a hate crime assault against himself.", "The large price tag was calculated to account for the police investigation that amounted to 3,000 hours of work, authorities have said. The lawsuit was originally filed in April 2019, soon after investigators began questioning the veracity of Smollett's claims.", "", "
The City of Chicago confirmed it will continue its lawsuit against actor Jussie Smollett to recoup costs for the investigation he was convicted of staging. In this photo, Smollett is seen after his court appearance at Leighton Courthouse on March 26, 2019 in Chicago, Illinois.
", "\"The City filed a civil lawsuit against Jussie Smollett to recover costs incurred by the Chicago Police Department investigating what the City believed to be Smollett's false police reports that he was a victim of a hate crime,\" the statement said. \"While using a different standard of proof, the jury's finding of guilt convicting Jussie Smollett of criminal charges stemming from the incident confirms that the City was correct in bringing its civil lawsuit.\"", "The statement continued, \"The City intends to continue to pursue its lawsuit to hold Smollett accountable for his unlawful actions and to demand that he compensate the City for costs incurred by the Chicago Police Department which took his false claims of harm seriously.\"", "The former cast member of the hit Fox show Empire was found guilty last Thursday of lying to police and staging an attack on himself as a hate crime hoax.", "The police investigation involved authorities searching through hundreds of hours of surveillance footage, as well as arresting the Osundairo brothers. After questioning those two men, police then changed the course of the investigation to look into if Smollett had staged the crime.", "Smollett had originally told police in January 2019 that he was the victim of a racist and homophobic attack while out late at night in Chicago. He claimed two attackers punched him in the face, poured an \"unknown chemical substance\" on him, and wrapped a rope around his neck.", "The actor also reported the attackers made reference to \"MAGA country,\" a reference to then-President Donald Trump's slogan of \"Make American Great Again.\"", "Once investigators shifted the focus to Smollett staging the attack, he was arrested in February 2019 but then cleared of all charges a month later. In February 2020, a special prosecutor assigned to the case announced he would seek charges against Smollett.", "Smollett was found guilty on five of six counts of disorderly conduct on Thursday. He is still awaiting sentencing.", "Smollett's case is expected to still see more legal repercussions. Following the original charge of felony disorderly against Smollett being dropped in 2019, the Osundairo brothers sued Smollett's attorneys for defamation over claims the case damaged their careers and reputations.", "A federal judge had stayed their lawsuit until the criminal proceedings were completed for Smollett. Now, they are open to continue their lawsuit as well."]
